channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Shopify partners with Coinbase and Stripe in landmark stablecoin deal
item.description: Senior Coinbase exec Jesse Pollak described the deal as a 'holy crap' moment for the payment industry.

item.title: Flights Grounded at Boston’s Logan Airport After JetBlue Plane Rolls Off Runway
item.description: A ground stop was in place at the airport, its operator said, after a JetBlue plane veered into a grassy area after landing. There were no injuries, a...

item.title: Harvey Weinstein Retrial: Judge Declares Mistrial on Final Sex Crime Charge
item.description: The jury had earlier convicted Harvey Weinstein of one felony sex crime, but jury deliberations had devolved into threats and yelling.

item.title: Pixar exec says former boss Steve Jobs called workers anytime, even at 3 a.m. and on vacation—but it’s a red flag he won’t repeat
item.description: Tesla billionaire Elon Musk was known to send out important emails as late as 2:30 a.m, while Jeff Bezos’ Amazon culture expected employees to answer ...

item.title: Tyrese Haliburton was voted ‘most overrated’ by his own peers. The 25-year-old is now on the cusp of winning it all, outshining the biggest NBA stars
item.description: Haliburton has scored four clutch game-winning shots in the 2025 NBA Playoffs—one in each round.

item.title: How “Pet Sounds” Became the Beach Boys Masterpiece
item.description: Brian Wilson’s 1966 masterpiece is now considered a crowning achievement of music. The album’s reputation grew over time.

item.title: Russian Scientist Released After Four Months in Federal Custody
item.description: Kseniia Petrova, a Harvard researcher, still faces criminal charges for failing to declare scientific samples she was carrying in her suitcase.

item.title: A G.O.P. Plan to Sell Public Land Is Back. This Time, It’s Millions of Acres.
item.description: Senate Republicans want to sell the land to build more housing in the West, but the idea is contentious even within their own party.

item.title: This Cognizant executive says the $37 billion company is abandoning hierarchy and adopting a culture of accepting failure
item.description: Executive Ganesh Ayyar is also fearful of AI—but bringing employees and customers to the table about strategy has helped alleviate his anxieties.

item.title: Wealthy couples often face an estate tax: Here’s their favorite legal maneuver to get around it
item.description: Spousal lifetime access trusts, or SLATs, provide myriad benefits—but also come with risks.

item.title: U.N. Watchdog Rules That Iran Is Not Complying With Nuclear Obligations
item.description: The decision comes as officials say they believe that Israel is preparing to launch a military attack on Iran. Tehran condemned the vote.

item.title: Live Updates: Over 200 Dead in Air India Crash, Official Says, With at Least One Survivor
item.description: The London-bound Boeing Dreamliner went down moments after takeoff in Ahmedabad, India, with 242 people aboard. India’s home minister said he had met ...

item.title: U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem Braces for Possible Israeli Strike on Iran
item.description: The diplomatic mission restricted the movement of employees and their families a day after the United States withdrew diplomats from Iraq.

item.title: What We Know About the Plane Crash in Ahmedabad, India
item.description: More than 200 people were killed when an Air India plane traveling to London crashed in Ahmedabad, India, an official said. At least one person surviv...

item.title: How the Air India Crash Compares With Other Deadly Plane Disasters
item.description: Plane travel is statistically one of the safest modes of travel. But when things goes wrong, the results are often disastrous.
